meanings.definition: To cry noisily, taking in short, sudden breaths.
meanings.sent1: She was sobbing uncontrollably after watching the sad movie.
meanings.sent2: The child started sobbing when he dropped his ice cream cone.
meanings.sent3: The puppy looked at its empty food bowl and started sobbing comically.
meanings.sent4: The wind howled through the trees, sounding like nature sobbing in sorrow.
meanings.sent5: Her heart felt like it was sobbing with every beat, filled with sadness.

meanings.definition: The act of crying noisily, taking in short, sudden breaths.
meanings.sent1: His loud sobbing could be heard throughout the house.
meanings.sent2: The sobbing of the child kept the whole family awake at night.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's fake sobbing during the show made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The sobbing of the violin echoed through the concert hall, touching every heart.
meanings.sent5: The sound of sobbing in the hospital room was a reminder of the fragility of life.
